meanings.sent1: The spilled coffee will maculate the clean tablecloth.
meanings.sent2: She accidentally maculated her white shirt with ink.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy managed to maculate the freshly mopped floor with muddy paw prints.
meanings.sent4: The graffiti artist's spray paint cans maculate the once pristine walls of the alley.
meanings.sent5: The oil spill continued to maculate the ocean, causing harm to marine life.

meanings.sent1: The maculate mirror reflected a distorted image.
meanings.sent2: The old book had maculate pages from years of use.
meanings.sent3: Despite its maculate appearance, the antique vase held sentimental value.
meanings.sent4: The maculate leopard blended perfectly into the dappled sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The maculate carpet showed years of wear and tear in the high-traffic areas.
